text: bilateral tympanostomy with myringotomy tube placement
context: bilateral tympanostomy with myringotomy tube placement.
the patient is a 1-year-old male with a history of chronic otitis media with effusion and conductive hearing loss refractory to outpatient medical therapy.
the patient is a 1-year-old male with a history of chronic otitis media with effusion and conductive hearing loss refractory to outpatient medical therapy.
the patient is a 1-year-old male with a history of chronic otitis media with effusion and conductive hearing loss refractory to outpatient medical therapy.
the patient is a 1-year-old male with a history of chronic otitis media with effusion and conductive hearing loss refractory to outpatient medical therapy.
the external auditory canal was removed off of its cerumen with a #5 suction which led to the direct visualization of the tympanic membrane.
after this, the tympanic membrane is then brought into direct visualization with no signs of any gross retracted pockets or cholesteatoma.
the tympanic membrane appeared with no signs of retraction pockets, cholesteatoma or air fluid levels.
a myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant and the middle ear was then suctioned with a #5 suction demonstrating dry contents.
a _________ split tube 1.0 mm was then placed with an alligator forcep.
the patient had cortisporin otic drops followed by cotton balls placed.
the tympanic membrane appeared with no signs of retraction pockets, cholesteatoma or air fluid levels.
the tympanic membrane appeared with no signs of retraction pockets, cholesteatoma or air fluid levels.
the patient will be followed up approximately in one week and was sent home with a prescription for ciloxan ear drops to be used as directed and with instructions not to get any water in the ears.
